sub_topic: Preparation of p-nitroaniline from aniline and nitric acid
message_1: What is the appropriate ratio of aniline to nitric acid needed to synthesize 5 grams of p-nitroaniline with a yield of 85%?
message_2:
To determine the appropriate ratio of aniline to nitric acid, we first need to find the amount of aniline required to synthesize 5 grams of p-nitroaniline with a yield of 85%.

1. Calculate the theoretical yield:
Actual yield (p-nitroaniline) = 5 g
Percentage yield = 85%

Theoretical yield = Actual yield / Percentage yield
Theoretical yield = 5 g / 0.85 = 5.88 g

2. Determine the moles of p-nitroaniline in the theoretical yield:
Molar mass of p-nitroaniline = 138.12 g/mol (C6H6N2O2)

Moles of p-nitroaniline = Theoretical yield / Molar mass
Moles of p-nitroaniline = 5.88 g / 138.12 g/mol = 0.0426 mol

3. Determine the moles of aniline required:
The balanced chemical equation for the synthesis of p-nitroaniline is:

C6H7N (aniline) + HNO3 (nitric acid) → C6H6N2O2 (p-nitroaniline) + H2O

From the balanced equation, 1 mole of aniline reacts with 1 mole of nitric acid to produce 1 mole of p-nitroaniline.

Moles of aniline required = Moles of p-nitroaniline = 0.0426 mol

4. Determine the mass of aniline required:
Molar mass of aniline = 93.13 g/mol (C6H7N)

Mass of aniline = Moles of aniline × Molar mass
Mass of aniline = 0.0426 mol × 93.13 g/mol = 3.97 g

5. Determine the mass of nitric acid required:
Molar mass of nitric acid = 63.01 g/mol (HNO3)

Mass of nitric acid = Moles of p-nitroaniline × Molar mass
Mass of nitric acid = 0.0426 mol × 63.01 g/mol = 2.68 g

6. Calculate the ratio of aniline to nitric acid:
Ratio = Mass of aniline / Mass of nitric acid
Ratio = 3.97 g / 2.68 g = 1.48

The appropriate ratio of aniline to nitric acid needed to synthesize 5 grams of p-nitroaniline with a yield of 85% is approximately 1.48:1.
